title: Error when only predicting ligand
body:
Hi! I wanna only predict the ligand structure, but proteinix raised errors:

```bash
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/workspace/runner/inference.py", line 213, in main
    runner.dumper.dump(
  File "/workspace/runner/dumper.py", line 74, in dump
    self.dump_predictions(
  File "/workspace/runner/dumper.py", line 107, in dump_predictions
    self._save_structure(
  File "/workspace/runner/dumper.py", line 135, in _save_structure
    save_structure_cif(
  File "/workspace/protenix/data/utils.py", line 181, in save_structure_cif
    save_atoms_to_cif(
  File "/workspace/protenix/data/utils.py", line 154, in save_atoms_to_cif
    cifwriter.save_to_cif(
  File "/workspace/protenix/data/utils.py", line 288, in save_to_cif
    block_dict.update(self._get_entity_poly_and_entity_poly_seq_block())
  File "/workspace/protenix/data/utils.py", line 260, in _get_entity_poly_and_entity_poly_seq_block
    "entity_poly": pdbx.CIFCategory(entity_poly),
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.10/site-packages/biotite/structure/io/pdbx/cif.py", line 327, in __init__
    columns = {
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.10/site-packages/biotite/structure/io/pdbx/cif.py", line 328, in <dictcomp>
    key: CIFColumn(col) if not isinstance(col, CIFColumn) else col
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.10/site-packages/biotite/structure/io/pdbx/cif.py", line 138, in __init__
    data = CIFData(data, str)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.10/site-packages/biotite/structure/io/pdbx/cif.py", line 66, in __init__
    self._array = _arrayfy(array)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.10/site-packages/biotite/structure/io/pdbx/cif.py", line 1061, in _arrayfy
    raise ValueError("Array must contain at least one element")
ValueError: Array must contain at least one element
```

The json file is:
```
[
    {
        "sequences": [
            {
                "ligand": {
                    "ligand": "COc1cc(OC)ccc1/C=C/N(C(=O)C)C",
                    "count": 1
                }
            }
        ],
        "modelSeeds": [],
        "assembly_id": "1",
        "name": "LIG_1"
    }
]

```
author: v-shaoningli

comments.body:
Hi Shaoning, 

This issue has been resolved in the recent code update. The task results without polymer can now be saved normally. 
Thank you for the feedback :D
Thanks for the update!

satisfaction_conditions: A solution that allows predicting only ligand structures without errors
Proper handling of cases where only ligand data is provided in the input JSON
Successful saving/output of prediction results for ligand-only tasks

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM ai4s-cn-beijing.cr.volces.com/pytorch-mirror/pytorch:2.3.1-cuda12.1-cudnn8-devel

# Set environment variables
ENV DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive
ENV TZ=Asia/Shanghai

# Install system dependencies
RUN apt-get update && \
    apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    wget \
    g++ \
    gcc \
    libc6-dev \
    make zlib1g zlib1g-dev \
    git git-lfs expect zsh vim wget curl unzip zip cmake cmake-curses-gui libgdbm-dev libnss3-dev libssl-dev libreadline-dev libffi-dev \
    libxrender1 libxext6 iproute2 \
    postgresql \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install HHsuite
RUN DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get update && \
    apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y hmmer cmake cmake-curses-gui && \
    git clone --branch v3.3.0 https://github.com/soedinglab/hh-suite.git /tmp/hh-suite && \
    mkdir /tmp/hh-suite/build && \
    cd /tmp/hh-suite/build && \
    cmake -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/opt/hhsuite .. && \
    make -j 32 && make install && \
    ln -s /opt/hhsuite/bin/* /usr/bin && \
    cd - && \
    rm -rf /tmp/hh-suite && \
    apt-get clean && \
    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install Python dependencies
RUN pip3 --no-cache-dir install \
    scipy \
    ml_collections \
    tqdm \
    pandas \
    dm-tree==0.1.6 \
    rdkit=="2023.03.01" \
    biopython==1.83 \
    modelcif==0.7 \
    biotite==1.0.1 \
    gemmi==0.6.5 \
    pdbeccdutils==0.8.5 \
    scikit-learn==1.2.2 \
    scikit-learn-extra \
    deepspeed==0.14.4 \
    protobuf==3.20.2 \
    tos icecream ipdb wandb numpy==1.26.3 matplotlib==3.9.2 ipywidgets py3Dmol

# For H20 compatibility
RUN pip3 install --no-cache-dir nvidia-cublas-cu12==12.4.5.8 --no-deps

# Clone CUTLASS for DeepSpeed DS4Sci_EvoformerAttention kernel
RUN git clone -b v3.5.1 https://github.com/NVIDIA/cutlass.git /opt/cutlass
ENV CUTLASS_PATH=/opt/cutlass

# Clone the repository and checkout the specific commit
WORKDIR /workspace
RUN git clone https://github.com/bytedance/Protenix.git && \
    cd Protenix && \
    git checkout a7803a8f137d256285b5b83f3338a0ee17f2e91d

# Install the package in development mode
WORKDIR /workspace/Protenix
RUN pip install -e .

# Create data directories that might be needed for inference
RUN mkdir -p /af3-dev/release_data /af3-dev/release_model

# Add information about downloading model and data files
RUN echo "To download model files run:" > /workspace/README_FIRST.txt && \
    echo "wget -P /af3-dev/release_model/ https://af3-dev.tos-cn-beijing.volces.com/release_model/model_v1.pt" >> /workspace/README_FIRST.txt && \
    echo "" >> /workspace/README_FIRST.txt && \
    echo "To download minimal data files needed for inference:" >> /workspace/README_FIRST.txt && \
    echo "wget -P /af3-dev/release_data/ https://af3-dev.tos-cn-beijing.volces.com/release_data/components.v20240608.cif" >> /workspace/README_FIRST.txt && \
    echo "wget -P /af3-dev/release_data/ https://af3-dev.tos-cn-beijing.volces.com/release_data/components.v20240608.cif.rdkit_mol.pkl" >> /workspace/README_FIRST.txt

# Set the working directory
WORKDIR /workspace

title: Cannot find package '.../node_modules/mcp-proxy/dist/MCPProxy.js' when running npx fastmcp dev
body:
I'm trying to run the example server from the repo and am getting the following error with both `npx fastmcp dev src/server.ts`. This also occurs if I build the server and run `npx fastmcp dev dist/server.js`.

```
$ npx fastmcp dev src/server.ts

node:internal/modules/run_main:104
    triggerUncaughtException(
    ^
Error: Cannot find package '/Users/nbbaier/my-mcp-server/node_modules/mcp-proxy/dist/MCPProxy.js' imported from /Users/nbbaier/my-mcp-server/node_modules/fastmcp/dist/FastMCP.js
    at legacyMainResolve (node:internal/modules/esm/resolve:204:26)
    at packageResolve (node:internal/modules/esm/resolve:778:12)
    at moduleResolve (node:internal/modules/esm/resolve:854:18)
    at defaultResolve (node:internal/modules/esm/resolve:984:11)
    at nextResolve (node:internal/modules/esm/hooks:748:28)
    at resolveBase (file:///Users/nbbaier/.npm/_npx/fd45a72a545557e9/node_modules/tsx/dist/esm/index.mjs?1741544730509:2:3212)
    at resolveDirectory (file:///Users/nbbaier/.npm/_npx/fd45a72a545557e9/node_modules/tsx/dist/esm/index.mjs?1741544730509:2:3584)
    at resolveTsPaths (file:///Users/nbbaier/.npm/_npx/fd45a72a545557e9/node_modules/tsx/dist/esm/index.mjs?1741544730509:2:4073)
    at resolve (file:///Users/nbbaier/.npm/_npx/fd45a72a545557e9/node_modules/tsx/dist/esm/index.mjs?1741544730509:2:4447)
    at nextResolve (node:internal/modules/esm/hooks:748:28) {
  code: 'ERR_MODULE_NOT_FOUND'
}

Node.js v23.9.0
file:///Users/nbbaier/.npm/_npx/234164726e649089/node_modules/@modelcontextprotocol/sdk/dist/esm/shared/protocol.js:93
        const error = new McpError(ErrorCode.ConnectionClosed, "Connection closed");
                      ^

McpError: MCP error -32000: Connection closed
    at Client._onclose (file:///Users/nbbaier/.npm/_npx/234164726e649089/node_modules/@modelcontextprotocol/sdk/dist/esm/shared/protocol.js:93:23)
    at _transport.onclose (file:///Users/nbbaier/.npm/_npx/234164726e649089/node_modules/@modelcontextprotocol/sdk/dist/esm/shared/protocol.js:68:18)
    at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (file:///Users/nbbaier/.npm/_npx/234164726e649089/node_modules/@modelcontextprotocol/sdk/dist/esm/client/stdio.js:85:77)
    at ChildProcess.emit (node:events:507:28)
    at maybeClose (node:internal/child_process:1101:16)
    at ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal/child_process:305:5) {
  code: -32000,
  data: undefined
}

Node.js v23.9.0
```
author: nbbaier

comments.body: I believe this was just a badly resolved dependency. If you update your dependencies and try again, it should be fixed.
Yeah that worked great, thanks!

satisfaction_conditions: A solution that resolves the dependency error for mcp-proxy
A straightforward fix that allows the user to run their FastMCP server
A solution that addresses the dependency resolution without requiring code changes

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM node:20-slim

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Install necessary tools
RUN apt-get update && \
    apt-get install -y git && \
    apt-get clean && \
    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Clone the repository and checkout specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/punkpeye/fastmcp.git . && \
    git checkout 1314f06919e1f20b725d648390336ce4afe16a23

# Install pnpm (as used in the project)
RUN npm install -g pnpm@9

# Install project dependencies
RUN pnpm install

# Build the project
RUN pnpm build

# This Dockerfile sets up an environment with:
# 1. Node.js 20 as the base image
# 2. Git installed to clone the repository
# 3. The fastmcp repository cloned and checked out to the specific commit
# 4. PNPM installed (as used in the project workflows)
# 5. Project dependencies installed
# 6. Project built and ready to use

title: Add Custom Edge Sorting with Predicate Function added edgeRetrieval.cpp
author: ash01825

comments.body:
@ash01825 I am not able to edit these files in the PR, maybe you have disabled the option that allows maintainers to edit the code. 

There are a few changes need to be done, the first one is to include ``<functional>`` header in ``GraphMatrix.h`` without which ``std::function`` wont work.
Second one is to add a check in your ``getAllEdges`` function, if the graph is unweighted you cannot really return anything, so throw an exception at that point.

If you can enable the option that allows me to edit the code in the PR then it will be good, as i have to do some changes in example and the function also.
shouldn't getAllEdges return all existing Edges for Unweighted Graphs too?

> shouldn't getAllEdges return all existing Edges for Unweighted Graphs too?

Interesting, well yes it can, but in the returned tuple 
```cpp
std::vector<std::tuple<VertexType, VertexType, EdgeType>
```
the ``EdgeType`` will be ``UnweightedG`` and user cannot actually use ``UnweightedG`` anywhere, maybe there is a way we can return 
this for weighted graphs
```cpp
std::vector<std::tuple<VertexType, VertexType, EdgeType>
```
and this for unweighted graphs?
```cpp
std::vector<std::tuple<VertexType, VertexType>
```

@ash01825 Possibly we can utilize ``std::variant`` but will require more code. although this is not that important as of now.

> > shouldn't getAllEdges return all existing Edges for Unweighted Graphs too?
> 
> Interesting, well yes it can, but in the returned tuple
> 
> ```c++
> std::vector<std::tuple<VertexType, VertexType, EdgeType>
> ```
> 
> the `EdgeType` will be `UnweightedG` and user cannot actually use `UnweightedG` anywhere, maybe there is a way we can return this for weighted graphs
> 
> ```c++
> std::vector<std::tuple<VertexType, VertexType, EdgeType>
> ```
> 
> and this for unweighted graphs?
> 
> ```c++
> std::vector<std::tuple<VertexType, VertexType>
> ```
@ash01825 any update?
yeah sorry was out yesterday yeah I've made the changes

> yeah sorry was out yesterday yeah I've made the changes

Its fine no issues, the thing i am concerned about is that i want to make some changes to your current example file in this PR, but i dont have the permission to do so as you must have unchecked the ``allow maintainers to edit files`` while making this PR due to which i am not able to edit the files. 

So either you give me permission to edit the code or i'll have to make those changes after merging the PR, your call.
Yeah I've turned on the allow edit my maintainersüëç
@ash01825 I have approved the changes and PR will be merged in sometime. Till then you are free to work on some other issue.
@ash01825 The PR is merged, and points are assigned to you. Thank you for contributing, kindly star ‚≠ê the repository as it shows appreciation to repository maintainers for their work.

satisfaction_conditions: Inclusion of necessary header files for the implementation
Proper handling of edge retrieval for both weighted and unweighted graphs
Enabling maintainer edit permissions on the PR
Addressing all feedback from code review

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM ubuntu:22.04

# Set noninteractive installation to avoid prompts
ENV DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive

# Install dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    git \
    build-essential \
    cmake \
    g++ \
    make \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Create a working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Clone the repository and checkout the specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/SharonIV0X86/Appledore.git && \
    cd Appledore && \
    git checkout b60fe8c2f7a4dcd67abdbde03827dcd37ff4e999

# Set up a build directory
WORKDIR /app/Appledore/build

# Generate build system with CMake if there's a CMakeLists.txt, otherwise prepare for manual build
RUN if [ -f ../CMakeLists.txt ]; then \
        cmake ..; \
    else \
        echo "No CMakeLists.txt found. The project may require manual build."; \
        mkdir -p include examples; \
    fi

# Build the project if it has a CMakeLists.txt
RUN if [ -f ../CMakeLists.txt ]; then \
        make; \
    else \
        echo "Project ready for manual compilation."; \
    fi

# Set the working directory back to the project root
WORKDIR /app/Appledore

# The container is now ready with the project built or prepared for building
# Users can compile examples or work with the library headers as needed
CMD ["/bin/bash"]

title: Cannot remove plates from Known Plates Dashboard
body:
Running on Linux Docker with the latest repo changes.

Tested in both Chrome and Safari.

Clicking on the delete button within the table of known plates doesn't delete the plate.

Console Log:

```Failed to remove from known plates: ReferenceError: removeFromKnownPlates is not defined```
author: TinyShark

comments.body:
Thank you. Fix pushed. 

`docker compose down`, then `docker compose up -d` should fix. If not, `docker pull algertc/alpr-dashboard` and that should pull the latest version.

pulling the new image got it to work. Known plates are being removed correctly now.

Many thanks!

satisfaction_conditions: A solution that fixes the 'removeFromKnownPlates is not defined' error
Clear instructions on how to apply the fix to their Docker environment
Restoration of the ability to remove plates from the Known Plates Dashboard

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM node:18-bullseye AS builder

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Clone the repository and checkout specific commit
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y git && \
    git clone https://github.com/algertc/ALPR-Database.git . && \
    git checkout 95ee6d78b3c5f4466defc24c9212c6596125261b

# Copy package files and install dependencies
# Force the install to proceed despite errors
RUN npm install --legacy-peer-deps

# Build the application
RUN npm run build

# Create the production image
FROM node:18-bullseye

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Copy built assets and dependencies from builder stage
COPY --from=builder /app/.next ./.next
COPY --from=builder /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY --from=builder /app/public ./public
COPY --from=builder /app/package.json ./package.json
COPY --from=builder /app/next.config.js ./next.config.js

# Create config and auth directories to persist data
RUN mkdir -p /app/config /app/auth
VOLUME ["/app/config", "/app/auth"]

# Copy specific files needed for runtime
COPY --from=builder /app/schema.sql ./schema.sql
COPY --from=builder /app/lib ./lib
COPY --from=builder /app/middleware.js ./middleware.js
COPY --from=builder /app/app ./app
COPY --from=builder /app/components ./components
COPY --from=builder /app/hooks ./hooks

# Expose the application port
EXPOSE 3000

# Set environment variables
ENV NODE_ENV=production

# Command to run the application
CMD ["npm", "start"]
